scenarios.title: What Happens When Life Takes an Unexpected Turn?
scenarios.subtitle: Real families, real situations, real control and preparedness

before.situation: Sarah's husband had a heart attack. While he was in intensive care, she spent days trying to find their insurance papers, bank account information, and important contacts. The stress was overwhelming when she needed to focus on his recovery.
before.consequence: Days of searching for information and support.

after.situation: When Mark had his accident, his wife Lisa opened their family guide and found everything organized: insurance details, bank contacts, medical information, and even a list of people to notify. She could focus on what mattered most - being there for Mark.
after.benefit: Immediate access to everything she needed.

before.situation: When David's flight was delayed and he missed his daughter's emergency surgery, his wife couldn't access their savings account or find their medical insurance information. Critical decisions had to wait.

after.situation: When Emma's husband was traveling and she needed emergency funds for their son's surgery, she had immediate access to all account information, insurance details, and even pre-written authorization letters. No delays, no stress.
after.benefit: Everything accessible right when she needed it.

before.situation: After losing her father suddenly, Maria spent months trying to piece together his financial affairs. She found accounts she didn't know existed and missed important deadlines because documents were scattered everywhere.

after.situation: When John's family needed to handle his affairs, everything was clearly organized: a complete list of accounts, important contacts, step-by-step instructions, and even personal messages he'd prepared for each family member.
after.benefit: A clear path to follow in difficult times.

bottomCta.primary: Don't Let Your Family Face This Chaos
bottomCta.urgency: Every day you wait is another day your family is unprepared

testimonials.1: After my brother's sudden accident, I watched my sister-in-law struggle for weeks to find important documents and passwords. That's when I knew I couldn't let the same thing happen to my family.
testimonials.2: As a single mom running a business, I worried constantly about what would happen if something happened to me. Heritage Vault helped me organize everything.
testimonials.3: My wife has early-stage dementia, and I realized I needed to prepare while I still could. Heritage Vault made it simple to organize our 40 years of life together.

testimonial.quote: I never realized how much stress I was carrying until I got everything organized. Now I know my family will be okay, no matter what happens.
testimonial.author: Sarah M., mother of three

testimonials.title: Trusted by 15,000+ European Families
testimonials.subtitle: See how families like yours found security and peace with Heritage Vault

stats.satisfactionLabel: feel more prepared and in control

1.name: Michael K.
1.quote: After my brother's sudden accident, I watched my sister-in-law struggle for weeks to find important documents and passwords. That's when I knew I couldn't let the same thing happen to my family. Now everything is organized, and my wife knows exactly where to find what she needs. Being prepared and in control is priceless.
1.highlight: ✨ Set up in just 2 hours, protecting 3 children and spouse

2.name: Anna S.
2.quote: As a single mom running a business, I worried constantly about what would happen if something happened to me. Heritage Vault helped me organize everything - from business accounts to my children's school information. My sister now has access to everything she'd need to step in. I sleep so much better knowing they're protected.
2.highlight: 💼 Business and personal life organized in one secure place

3.name: Thomas R.
3.quote: My wife has early-stage dementia, and I realized I needed to prepare while I still could. Heritage Vault made it simple to organize our 40 years of life together. Our children now have clear instructions and access to everything. It's brought our whole family closer knowing we're prepared for whatever comes.
3.highlight: ❤️ 40 years of family history preserved and protected

features.title: Three Simple Promises We Make to You
features.subtitle: Everything your family needs, nothing they don't. Simple, clear, and always there when it matters.

sleepBetter.title: Sleep Better Tonight
sleepBetter.description: Stop worrying about 'what if something happens to me.' Your family will know exactly what to do, where to find everything, and who to call.

noChaos.title: No Frantic Searching
noChaos.description: Your family won't spend days looking through drawers, calling banks, or trying to guess passwords. Everything important is organized in one secure place.

clearInstructions.title: Step-by-Step Guidance
clearInstructions.description: Your loved ones get clear, simple instructions for exactly what to do and when. No confusion, no guesswork, no stress during difficult times.

complexityReduction.title: Simplify Your Legacy Planning
complexityReduction.subtitle: Break down complex tasks into simple, manageable steps
complexityReduction.description: We understand that planning for the future can feel overwhelming. Our complexity reduction system breaks down every task into simple, actionable steps that take just minutes to complete.

overwhelm.title: Eliminates Overwhelm
overwhelm.description: Instead of facing a massive to-do list, you tackle one small task at a time. Each step is designed to be completed in under 5 minutes.

progress.title: Visible Progress
progress.description: See your family's preparedness grow with each completed step. Track your progress and celebrate small wins along the way.

confidence.title: Builds Confidence
confidence.description: As you complete each step, you'll feel more confident and in control. What once seemed impossible becomes achievable.

family.title: Family Protection
family.description: Every completed step directly protects your family. From emergency access to long-term planning, each action matters.

explanations.endToEndEncryption: Your data is scrambled into an unreadable code from the moment it leaves your device until you view it again.
explanations.secureCloudStorage: Your encrypted data is stored in world-class, physically secure data centers.
explanations.localOnlyPrivacyMode: When you use Local-Only Mode, your sensitive documents are never sent to our servers.
explanations.multiFactorAuthentication: Requires both your password and a code from your phone to log in.
explanations.europeanDataCenters: All your data is stored exclusively in secure European data centers with strict privacy laws.
explanations.zeroKnowledgeArchitecture: We've designed our system so we can't see your data, even if we wanted to.

analogies.endToEndEncryption: It's like sending a letter in a locked box that only you have the key to open.
analogies.secureCloudStorage: It's like keeping your locked box inside a bank vault with 24/7 guards.
analogies.localOnlyPrivacyMode: It's like writing your most private notes in a diary that never leaves your house.
analogies.multiFactorAuthentication: It's like needing both a key and a secret handshake to get into a private club.
analogies.europeanDataCenters: It's like choosing to store your valuables in a country known for its strong privacy protection.
analogies.zeroKnowledgeArchitecture: It's like having a safety deposit box where even the bank manager doesn't have the key.

familyBenefits.endToEndEncryption: Ensures that no one—not even us—can read your personal information.
familyBenefits.secureCloudStorage: Protects your plan from being lost to fire, theft, or computer failure.
familyBenefits.localOnlyPrivacyMode: Gives you absolute certainty that your most private documents remain in your control.
familyBenefits.multiFactorAuthentication: Prevents anyone from accessing your account, even if they steal your password.
familyBenefits.europeanDataCenters: Your family's data is protected by some of the world's strongest privacy regulations.
familyBenefits.zeroKnowledgeArchitecture: Your family's secrets remain secrets, protected from everyone including us.

lifeEvents.title: Life Events
lifeEvents.subtitle: Update your plan when major life changes occur

lifeEvents.congratsMessage: Congratulations on your new child! Here are the recommended updates to your plan:

tasks.updateBeneficiariesDesc: Review and update beneficiaries on life insurance, retirement accounts, and bank accounts.
tasks.updateWillDesc: Ensure your will reflects your new marital status and beneficiary wishes.
tasks.reviewTrustsDesc: Make necessary changes to trust documents to reflect your new status.
tasks.updateEmergencyContactsDesc: Review and update emergency contacts in your Trusted Circle.

tasks.addChildRosterDesc: Include your child in your family information.
tasks.updateGuardian: Review and update the "Guardian" designation for your children

tasks.reviewLifeInsurance: Review your life insurance policy to ensure coverage is adequate
tasks.reviewLifeInsuranceDesc: Consider increasing coverage to account for your growing family.
tasks.updateWillBeneficiary: Update your will to include your new child as a beneficiary
tasks.updateWillBeneficiaryDesc: Ensure your new child is properly included in your estate planning.

tasks.updateMortgageInfoDesc: Ensure all property-related documents are current.
tasks.reviewHomeownersInsuranceDesc: Update insurance policies to reflect your current properties.
tasks.updateNetWorthDesc: Reflect the change in your real estate holdings.
tasks.addBusinessAssetsDesc: Include your business as an asset with relevant details.
tasks.createSuccessionPlanDesc: Document what should happen to your business if something happens to you.
tasks.updateInsuranceDesc: Consider key person insurance and business liability coverage.
tasks.separatePersonalBusiness: Ensure personal and business assets are properly separated
tasks.separatePersonalBusinessDesc: Review the distinction between personal and business holdings.
tasks.removeDeceasedDesc: Remove the deceased person and reassign their responsibilities.
tasks.appointNewExecutor: Appoint a new executor/trustee if needed
tasks.appointNewExecutorDesc: If the deceased was your executor or trustee, designate a replacement.
tasks.updateBeneficiariesDesc2: Check if the deceased was a beneficiary on any accounts.

cookies.bannerText: We use essential cookies to ensure the proper functioning of our site. With your consent, we may also use analytical cookies to improve our services.

policy.title: Cookie Policy
policy.subtitle: Understanding how we use cookies to improve your experience while respecting your privacy

overview.title: Important Information
overview.intro: This Cookie Policy explains how LegacyGuard uses cookies and similar technologies to recognize you when you visit our website. It explains what these technologies are and why we use them, as well as your rights to control our use of them.
overview.point1: We use cookies to ensure the basic functionalities of our website
overview.point2: Some cookies are essential and cannot be disabled
overview.point3: You can control non-essential cookies through our consent manager
overview.point4: We never sell your data or use cookies for invasive tracking

necessary.title: Strictly Necessary Cookies
necessary.description: These cookies are essential for the website to function properly
necessary.purpose: Enable core functionality such as security, identity verification, and network management. These cookies cannot be disabled.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.description: Help us understand how visitors interact with our website
analytics.purpose: Collect anonymous information about how you use our site, helping us improve user experience and identify issues.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.purpose: Track visitors across websites to display ads that are relevant and engaging for individual users.

preferences.title: Preference Cookies
preferences.purpose: Allow the website to remember choices you make (such as language or region) and provide enhanced, personalized features.

yourRights.title: Your Rights
yourRights.description: You have full control over your cookie preferences
yourRights.right1: Access information about the cookies we use
yourRights.right2: Withdraw consent for non-essential cookies at any time
yourRights.right4: Opt-out of analytics and marketing cookies

contact.title: Contact Us About Cookies
contact.description: If you have any questions about our use of cookies or this Cookie Policy, please contact us:
contact.addressDetails: LegacyGuard Ltd, Data Protection Office, 123 Privacy Street, Dublin, Ireland

helpPage.title: Help & Support Center
helpPage.subtitle: We're here for you. Find answers to your questions or contact us directly.

q1.question: Is LegacyGuard secure?
q1.answer: Yes, security is our highest priority. We use end-to-end encryption and a zero-trust architecture, meaning no unauthorized person can access your data, not even us. All data is stored in secure data centers within the European Union in compliance with GDPR.

q2.question: What happens to my data if I cancel my subscription?
q2.answer: After canceling, your data remains securely stored in read-only mode for 90 days. You can reactivate your subscription anytime within this period to regain full access. After 90 days, your data will be securely and permanently deleted from our systems.

q3.question: What is a 'Guardian'?
q3.answer: A Guardian is someone you trust (e.g., a partner, sibling, or legal professional) whom you grant special, limited access to your information for emergencies. They cannot change your data; they can only view it to act on your instructions.

q4.question: What's the difference between the 'Vault' and the 'Manual'?
q4.answer: The Heritage Vault is where you securely store all your important papers and things you own. The Survivor's Manual is a curated selection of the most critical contacts, papers, and instructions from your vault, designed for your trusted helpers to have everything essential in one place.

q5.question: Is a will created in LegacyGuard legally binding?
q5.answer: LegacyGuard helps you prepare and organize all the groundwork and information for your will. However, in most European countries, the digital document does not replace the need for an official, signed (and often notarized) document. We recommend always consulting the final version with a legal professional.

descriptions.asyncError: Triggers an asynchronous error that will be caught by error handling
descriptions.regularError: Logs a regular error for testing error tracking
descriptions.criticalError: Logs a critical error for testing critical error handling
descriptions.multipleErrors: Triggers multiple critical errors to test alert thresholds

subtitle.edit: Create personalized instructions and information for this guardian.
subtitle.view: Essential information and instructions prepared for you.

funeral.title: Funeral Wishes
funeral.description: Your preferences for funeral arrangements and memorial services.
funeral.placeholder:
Describe your wishes for your funeral or memorial service...

For example:
- Type of service (religious, secular, celebration of life)
- Burial or cremation preferences
- Location preferences
- Music, readings, or special requests
- Who should speak or participate
- Any specific traditions to follow

digital.title: Digital Accounts Shutdown
digital.description: Instructions for handling your digital presence and online accounts.
digital.placeholder:
List your digital accounts and how they should be handled...

For example:
- Social media accounts (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn)
- Email accounts
- Cloud storage (Google Drive, Dropbox)
- Subscription services (Netflix, Spotify)
- Online banking and financial accounts
- Cryptocurrency wallets
- Website or domain names

contacts.title: Important Contacts
contacts.description: Key people this guardian should contact or notify.
contacts.placeholder: Add important contacts specific to this guardian's responsibilities.

documents.title: Document Locations
documents.description: Where to find important physical and digital documents.
documents.placeholder:
Describe where important documents are located...

For example:
- Will and testament location
- Insurance policies
- Property deeds
- Bank account information
- Investment documents
- Tax returns
- Passwords and access codes
- Safety deposit box location and key

messages.title: Personal Messages
messages.description: Personal messages and final thoughts for this guardian.
messages.placeholder:
Write a personal message to this guardian...

This is your opportunity to:
- Express your feelings and gratitude
- Share important memories
- Provide guidance or advice
- Explain your decisions
- Leave words of comfort
- Share your hopes for the future

practical.title: Practical Instructions
practical.description: Immediate practical steps and responsibilities for this guardian.
practical.placeholder:
List practical tasks and immediate actions...

For example:
- First 24-48 hours checklist
- Who to notify first
- Urgent bills or payments
- Care instructions (pets, plants, property)
- Business matters requiring attention
- Scheduled appointments to cancel
- Keys and access codes needed
